article_title: Group Challenges New York City on Housing Allocations
article_text:
A fair-housing group filed a lawsuit on Tuesday challenging New York City’s practice of allotting half of its new affordable-housing units to residents of particular communities, a move that could upend Mayor Bill de Blasio’s affordable-housing plan.

The lawsuit, filed by the New York-based Anti-Discrimination Center, alleges that the citywide policy of “community preference” violates the Fair Housing Act of 1968, which prohibits...
